Dear Mrs. Emmorey:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager Jessica VandenHeuvel at (616) 204-6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Jennifer Pastorick, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Program statement
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents' needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth reported engaging in sexual activity with another youth at
the facility while sleeping on the floor in the youths bedroom.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
10/14/2024. Youth A reported on 10/5/2024 she slept on the floor
in Youth B and Youth C’s bedroom due to not getting along with
her roommate. Youth A reported she slept on the floor willingly in
between Youth B and Youth C’s beds. Staff 1 and Staff 2 were
both aware Youth A was sleeping on the floor in Youth B and
Youth C’s bedroom and allowed her to. Youth A reported this was
the only time she has slept in another bedroom that was not
assigned to her. Youth A reported Youth B touched her
inappropriately and “forced it on” her. Youth A reported Youth B
touched her on top of her clothing on her vagina and breast area.
Youth B did not say anything to Youth A when she touched her.
Youth A reported Youth B moved from her bed to the floor and laid
next to her. Youth A reported Youth B placed her large stuffed
animal in the bed and covered it with blankets so Staff 1 and Staff
2 would think she was in her bed. Youth A reported Youth B laid
on the floor with her for less than an hour. Youth A reported staff,
unsure specifically which staff, completed room checks while
Youth B was lying next to her on the ground however staff did not
see Youth B as they thought Youth B was in her bed. Youth A
reported Youth B threatened her if she told anyone she would
have Youth C beat her up. Youth A reported she told Youth B to
stop, and Youth B placed her hand over Youth A’s mouth. Youth
A reported she and Youth B are not allowed to be alone together
or share a bedroom at the facility. Youth A reported Chief
Administrator held a boundaries discussion with the youth at the
facility.
2

Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
10/14/2024. Youth B reported Youth A slept in her and Youth C’s
bedroom one night and Youth A tried to get her to do
“inappropriate stuff” with her. Youth B reported normally youth are
not allowed to sleep in bedrooms that they are not assigned to
however that night Youth A was not getting along with her
roommate. Youth B reported Youth A slept on the bedroom floor
between Youth B and Youth C’s beds. Youth B did not recall
which staff were working that night however reported staff
completed night checks on the youth. Youth B reported Youth A
kept grabbing her hand and put Youth B’s fingers in her mouth.
Youth A pulled Youth B’s hand and placed it in between Youth A’s
legs near her vagina. Youth B reported Youth A’s hand touched
her on top of her clothing on her vagina. Youth B reported she
pretended to be sleeping and rolled over. Youth B denied ever
leaving her bed and being on the floor next to Youth A. Youth B
reported staff completed checks and every time a staff would
come to do a check, Youth A would roll over and pretend to be
asleep so “we would not get caught”. Youth B reported no sexual
contact has occurred between her and Youth A since that night.
Youth B reported there is a safety plan in place and Youth A and
her are not allowed to be alone together.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
10/14/2024. Youth C reported Youth A slept in her and Youth B’s
bedroom one night after a football game because Youth A did not
want to sleep in her assigned bedroom. Youth C reported she did
not see anything inappropriate occur between Youth A and Youth
B. Youth C reported she did not think the staff working knew youth
couldn’t sleep in other youth’s bedrooms. Youth C did not recall
who the staff were that worked that night. Youth C reported staff
completed checks on her, Youth A, and Youth B every five
minutes. Youth C described room checks as the staff shining a
light in the bedroom to see the youth during every check. Youth C
reported this was the only time she was aware of when a youth
slept in a bedroom that was not their assigned bedroom.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
10/14/2024. Staff 1 reported she has worked at the facility for
approximately three months. Staff 1 reported Youth A and her
roommate were not getting along, and she and Staff 2 made the
decision to separate Youth A and Youth B during the shift. Staff 1
reported at bedtime Youth A went into Youth B and Youth C’s
bedroom to sleep on the floor. Youth A told Staff 1 she had
permission from Chief Administrator to sleep on Youth B and
3

Youth C’s bedroom floor. Staff 1 reported she just let it go and let
Youth A sleep in Youth B and Youth C’s bedroom without
following up with Chief Administrator. Staff 1 and Staff 2
completed night checks on Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C every
five to ten minutes and had no concerns as Youth A, Youth B, and
Youth C appeared to be asleep. Staff 1 reported she did not
believe anything actually occurred between Youth A and Youth B
as every check Youth A was on the floor and Youth B was in her
bed. Staff 1 reported Staff 2 was sitting outside Youth B and Youth
C’s bedroom door that night as he was doing constant supervision
on the youth in the next-door bedroom. Staff 1 reported the
position Staff 2 was sitting in allowed for him to see directly into
Youth B and Youth C’s bedroom. Staff 1 denied Youth B ever
coming out of the bedroom that night or verbalizing any concerns
which Staff 1 reported Youth B typically verbalizes concerns. Staff
1 reported she is aware youth are not supposed to sleep in other
youth’s bedrooms however that night she allowed it to occur due
to Youth A and her roommate not getting along and to keep them
separated. Staff 1 reported a safety plan was put into place for
Youth A and Youth B to ensure safety.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
10/14/2024. Staff 2 reported he has worked at the facility for
approximately five months. Staff 2 reported at bedtime Staff 1 was
in the house however he was focused on another youth who was
having issues. Staff 2 reported Youth A was already asleep in
Youth B and Youth C’s bedroom when he was done addressing a
separate incident. Staff 2 reported he sat outside Youth B and
Youth C’s bedroom door as he was providing constant supervision
on a youth in the bedroom right next to Youth B and Youth C’s
bedroom. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 was completing the bed checks
on Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C that night however he could
see in the bedroom from outside the door. Staff 2 reported he
was not involved in making the decision to allow Youth A to sleep
in Youth B and Youth C’s bedroom and he believed Staff 1 made
the decision. Staff 2 reported he is not aware of any other times
where Youth A slept in the same bedroom as Youth B or any
youth sleeping in bedrooms that was not their assigned bedroom.
Staff 2 reported he did not believe anything occurred between
Youth A and Youth B as he sat outside the bedroom door from
11pm until morning.
Chief Administrator was interviewed face-to-face at the
facility on 10/14/2024. Chief Administrator reported the facility
does not have a policy that indicates youth cannot sleep in one
another bedrooms however this will be something that is looked
4

into. Chief Administrator reported Youth A and Youth B were
immediately placed on a safety plan after the allegations were
made.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of 10/5/2024 was attempted to be reviewed on
10/14/2024 however there was no video footage for 10/5/2024.
The facility was unaware at the time that the camera system was
not recording as the space on the server was full. The facility is
working to install a new camera system to rectify the issue.
Documents Reviewed:
• Youth Opportunity River Oake Youth Center Assessment
and Treatment Plan Policy and Procedure: It is the policy to
ensure an effective classification system that promotes
safety and security as well as effective delivery of treatment
services based upon the determination of each youth’s
individual needs and risk factors. Initial classification
processes shall guide the most appropriate room
placement, living unit assignment and youth group or staff
advisor.
• Youth Opportunity River Oake Youth Center Youth
Supervision, Movement and Checks Policy: Staff shall
ensure the location of all youth, at all times. The program
shall ensure that staff observe youth at varying intervals at
least every ten minutes while they are in their sleeping
rooms, either during sleep, rest periods or other times
youth are in their rooms. Staff observations shall be
completed and documented in real time ensuring the safety
and security of each youth.
• Youth Opportunity Grievance Form completed by Youth B
on 10/9/2024 was consistent with Youth B’s interview.
• Youth Opportunity Safety Plan dated 10/9/2024 for Youth A
and Youth B was developed due to reported concerns.
Youth A and Youth B will be kept at a distance from one
another, will not be allowed in one another’s bedroom, will
be separated in the vehicle when transported, staff move
with youth in threes, and staff will immediately contact
administration of any concerns.
• Youth Opportunity bedtime logs dated 10/5/2024 completed
by Staff 1 indicated checks were completed every five
minutes on Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C.
5

Staff 1 and Staff 2’s personnel file: Staff 1 and Staff 2 received
written discipline on 10/9/2024 for the incident as they did not
follow chain of command and contact supervisor for verification to
allow Youth A to sleep on Youth B and Youth C’s floor. Staff 1
completed supervision training 7/24/2024, and Staff 2 on
8/7/2024.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as Staff 1 and Staff 2 provided
supervision and completed appropriate room checks. Per
interviews with youth and staff, staff completed checks on Youth
A, Youth B, and Youth C. Staff 2 sat outside the door all night due
to providing constant supervision on a youth in the room next to
Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C, and never saw or heard any noise
or concerns.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
Technical assistance was offered that the facility implement a
process to be followed for when youth’s bedrooms need to be
moved.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code Staff to resident ratio
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4127
Section (4) When residents are asleep or otherwise outside of the direct
Description supervision of staff, staff shall perform variable interval, eye-on
checks of residents. The time between the variable interval checks
shall not exceed fifteen minutes.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation The facility was not completing varying interval checks on youth.
Investigation Documents Reviewed:
• Youth Opportunity River Oake Youth Center Youth
Supervision, Movement and Checks Policy: Staff shall
ensure the location of all youth, at all times. The program
shall ensure that staff observe youth at varying intervals at
least every ten minutes while they are in their sleeping
rooms, either during sleep, rest periods or other times
youth are in their rooms. Staff observations shall be
completed and documented in real time ensuring the safety
and security of each youth.
• Youth Opportunity bedtime logs dated 10/5/2024 completed
by Staff 1 indicated checks were completed every five
minutes on Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C.
6

Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance as the facility was not
completing varying interval checks as the checks were completed
every five minutes.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
